name: places/ChIJbbHdIeRYwokRkJT49hZPE44
adrFormatAddress: 1070 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10022-2595, USA

originalText.text: Al from Ak Premier is the go to contractor for my building that we manage under First Service. He helped with gut renovations of apartments, correcting code violations, punch listing, and kept everything within the budget we needed. Some work he did for us is in the upper east side, Hell’s Kitchen area, and lower Manhattan. All of my residents have been happy with the quality and value. Highly recommend. They are also fully licensed, and insured.

text.text: Al from Ak Premier is the go to contractor for my building that we manage under First Service. He helped with gut renovations of apartments, correcting code violations, punch listing, and kept everything within the budget we needed. originalText.text:
Warning: contractor abandonment!

Hired for full renovation of my apartment. On the positive side, the quality of the work actually done was pretty good, with competitive pricing.

After a very promising start, the pace of work dropped dramatically after the initial demolition phase. It ultimately ran long past the end date. My apartment was completely uninhabitable for months and yet, many days or even weeks at a time, no one would show up to work at all. This was falsely blamed on nonessential appliances being backordered, such as the washing machine. Although this had no effect on the incomplete work such as light switches and electrical outlets, they instead chose to completely abandon the project at about 90% completion. This was apparently because of another, bigger job that they took on, but the owner abruptly stopped responding to communications, so I'll never know.

I had to find others to remove the heaps of trash and supplies they left behind, and ultimately complete the renovation. Needless to say, they also left many of their own mistakes uncorrected, and I was left without any sort of warranty on the work that actually was done. If you hire them for a small project, beware that a bigger one does not come along before yours is completed.
